resources.string: " Below you will find the target measurements based on your age. Take into consideration that blood oxygen saturation is for all age groups."
What do you want to know?
What to do in an emergency?

Heart rate is the number of heartbeats per minute. Do not confuse with heart rate or pulse. Resting heart rate varies with age. A healthy adult will have a frequency between 50 and 80 beats per minute. Theoretically, a person\'s maximum heart rate is 220 minus their age (example: 220 â€“ 40 years = 180). The heart rate is also at its maximum around noon. Digestion, heat or cold cause an increase in this frequency. In addition, stress factors influence data through three mechanisms: nervous, chemical and physical mechanisms. To learn more about heart rate, click the link below.

Colorimetric oximetry or pulsed oxygen saturation makes it possible to quantify the oxygen saturation of hemoglobin in blood capillaries. For a healthy person, this rate is between 95 and 100%. This rate decreases in a smoker. If the value is 93% please consult a doctor immediately. If it is 92%, medical emergency intervention is required. For more information, please visit the website below.

If you ever need an emergency, please call 911. Always consult a professional to explain your data, in case of suspicious values. To learn more about what to do in an emergency situation, please visit the following site.
1. Make sure the object is connected.
3. Place your finger on the chip.
